intro: Memecylon sousae, commonly known as the African memecylon, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. Memecylon sousae is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
